subject: Ethics
title: Xenotransplantation Risks
description: A short lesson to help you apply Xenotransplantation Risks.

hook.text: In 2022, a man received a pig heart. He survived two months. A pig virus was found inside.

buildup.text: Xenotransplantation means transplanting animal organs into humans to solve the donor shortage.

discovery.text: Gene-edited pigs can grow organs compatible with human immune systems. The science is advancing fast.

twist.text: Animal viruses could jump to humans through transplanted organs, potentially sparking new pandemics.

climax.text: We face a cruel trade-off: save dying patients now or protect populations from unknown future risks.

punchline.text: One patient's miracle could be everyone's outbreak.

quiz.question: What is a major risk of xenotransplantation?
options: Animal organs are always rejected immediately
There aren't enough pigs to meet demand
Animal viruses could jump to humans through transplanted organs
